name: Methaqualone
Reason: 1,2-propanediol, 3-(2-methoxyphenoxy)-, 1-carbam has a melting point of 92 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for our comparison will be ethanol, which has a melting point of -114.1 degrees Celsius (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methoxyphenoxy group, a methoxy group, and a carbamate group. Each of these functional groups introduces additional molecular weight and van der Waals forces, which raises the melting point. The methoxyphenoxy group introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The methoxy group introduces additional molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The carbamate group introduces additional hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The presence of these functional groups raises the melting point, but their individual contributions are difficult to quantify without experimental data or detailed computational studies.
